verses.verse: A Psalm <WH4210> of Asaph. <WH623> God <WH430> stands <WH5324> in the congregation <WH5712> of the mighty; <WH410> he judges <WH8199> among <WH8432> the gods. <WH430>
How <WH5704> long <WH5704> will you judge <WH8199> unjustly, <WH5766> and accept <WH5375> the persons <WH6440> of the wicked? <WH7563> Selah. <WH5542>
Defend <WH8199> the poor <WH1800> and fatherless: <WH3490> do justice <WH6663> to the afflicted <WH6041> and needy. <WH7326>
Deliver <WH6403> the poor <WH1800> and needy: <WH34> rid <WH5337> them out of the hand <WH3027> of the wicked. <WH7563>

They know <WH3045> not, neither <WH3808> will they understand; <WH995> they walk <WH1980> on in darkness: <WH2825> all <WH3605> the foundations <WH4146> of the earth <WH776> are out of course. <WH4131>
I have said, <WH559> You are gods; <WH430> and all <WH3605> of you are children <WH1121> of the most <WH5945> High. <WH5945>
But you shall die <WH4191> like men, <WH120> and fall <WH5307> like one <WH259> of the princes. <WH8269>
Arise, <WH6965> O God, <WH430> judge <WH8199> the earth: <WH776> for you shall inherit <WH5157> all <WH3605> nations. <WH1471>
